intro: Corydalis siamensis, commonly known as the Siam Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
